metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9078 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Redirection from an HTTP connection to a "data:" URL assigns the referringsite's origin to the "data:" URL in some circumstances. This can result insame-origin violations against a domain if it loads resources frommalicious sites. Cross-origin setting of cookies has been demonstratedwithout the ability to read them. Note: This issue only affects Firefox 49and 50. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 50.0.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9078` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 50.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 50.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 50.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 50.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '50.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
